intro: Hoffmannseggia trifoliata, commonly known as the three-leaved hoffmannseggia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth form. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Its leaves are trifoliate, meaning they are divided into three leaflets, which is a distinctive botanical feature. Hoffmannseggia trifoliata is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, showcasing succulent leaves that help store water.
